intro: Koellia mutica, commonly known as the narrow-leafed koellia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, narrow leaves that help reduce water loss. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, making it a distinctive feature in its natural environment. Koellia mutica is often found in grasslands and shrublands, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
